subtitle: A good dish for entertaining as it is mostly prepared and cooked ahead.

method.text: Melt the butter in a large frying pan. Add the diced lamb and fry until evenly browned. Remove the meat from the pan with a slotted spoon and place in an ovenproof dish.
Add the onion and carrots to the fat remaining in the pan and fry for about 5 min or until soft. Using the slotted spoon, add the vegetables to the meat.
Sprinkle the paprika and flour into the pan and fry for 2 min, stirring constantly. Gradually add the stock. Season to taste. Bring to boil and pour over the lamb and vegetables.
Cover the ovenproof dish with a lid or foil and bake for 2.5 - 1 days or until the meat is tender.

To make the dumplings, mix the flour, suet and mint in a bowl. Season to taste. Stir in enough water to make a soft but not sticky dough. Divide into small dumplings (2 per serving) and add these to the goulash 30 min before the end of the cooking time.
Stir in the yogurt just before serving, or pour it into a jug and offer separately.

title: Coromandel lamb goulash
